trans-unit.source: What's New in the October 2012 Release
trans-unit.target: What's New in the October 2012 Release

trans-unit.source: The <token>sb1</token> October 2012 release contains a number of new features and capabilities.
trans-unit.target: The <token>sb1</token> October 2012 release contains a number of new features and capabilities.

trans-unit.source: This topic summarizes the new features and contains links to more information.
trans-unit.target: This topic summarizes the new features and contains links to more information.

trans-unit.source: Message Lock Renewal
trans-unit.target: Message Lock Renewal

trans-unit.source: The <token>sb2</token> only supports a limited range of values for setting message locks.
trans-unit.target: The <token>sb2</token> only supports a limited range of values for setting message locks.

trans-unit.source: In some scenarios, you might require a longer message lock duration (via either lease extensions or higher default values).
trans-unit.target: In some scenarios, you might require a longer message lock duration (via either lease extensions or higher default values).

trans-unit.source: You can now renew a message lock.
trans-unit.target: You can now renew a message lock.

trans-unit.source: The following features are supported:
trans-unit.target: The following features are supported:

trans-unit.source: Ability to renew a lock on a message.
trans-unit.target: Ability to renew a lock on a message.

trans-unit.source: Message locks are bound to sessions.
trans-unit.target: Message locks are bound to sessions.

trans-unit.source: Locks are obtained for 60 seconds (by default) with a maximum of 5 minutes.
trans-unit.target: Locks are obtained for 60 seconds (by default) with a maximum of 5 minutes.

trans-unit.source: This is the same as the previous behavior.
trans-unit.target: This is the same as the previous behavior.

trans-unit.source: A call to <codeEntityReference>M:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.RenewLock</codeEntityReference> updates the message lock and updates the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.LockedUntilUtc</codeEntityReference> property once <languageKeyword>RenewLock</languageKeyword> completes.
trans-unit.target: A call to <codeEntityReference>M:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.RenewLock</codeEntityReference> updates the message lock and updates the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.LockedUntilUtc</codeEntityReference> property once <languageKeyword>RenewLock</languageKeyword> completes.

trans-unit.source: For message sessions, the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.LockedUntilUtc</codeEntityReference> property is populated when you accept a session using one of the client methods, such as <codeEntityReference>M:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueClient.AcceptMessageSession</codeEntityReference>, or one of the factory methods, such as <codeEntityReference>M:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.MessagingFactory.AcceptMessageSession(System.TimeSpan)</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: For message sessions, the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.LockedUntilUtc</codeEntityReference> property is populated when you accept a session using one of the client methods, such as <codeEntityReference>M:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueClient.AcceptMessageSession</codeEntityReference>, or one of the factory methods, such as <codeEntityReference>M:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.MessagingFactory.AcceptMessageSession(System.TimeSpan)</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: Session Browse
trans-unit.target: Session Browse

trans-unit.source: The <token>sb2</token> now supports the ability to browse message sessions on queues and subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: The <token>sb2</token> now supports the ability to browse message sessions on queues and subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: You can also retrieve a session whose state was updated at a given time.
trans-unit.target: You can also retrieve a session whose state was updated at a given time.

trans-unit.source: <token>crdefault</token>:
trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token>:

trans-unit.source: Entity Query
trans-unit.target: Entity Query

trans-unit.source: You can now retrieve a list of topics, queues, or subscriptions, based on an ODATA filter that you specify.
trans-unit.target: You can now retrieve a list of topics, queues, or subscriptions, based on an ODATA filter that you specify.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Using the REST API, the syntax would be:
trans-unit.target: Using the REST API, the syntax would be:

trans-unit.source: The following scenarios are supported:
trans-unit.target: The following scenarios are supported:

trans-unit.source: List all topics under a path; for example, /test1/test2.
trans-unit.target: List all topics under a path; for example, /test1/test2.

trans-unit.source: List all topics updated in the last 5 minutes.
trans-unit.target: List all topics updated in the last 5 minutes.

trans-unit.source: List all topics accessed in the last 5 minutes.
trans-unit.target: List all topics accessed in the last 5 minutes.

trans-unit.source: List all rules created in the last 5 minutes.
trans-unit.target: List all rules created in the last 5 minutes.

trans-unit.source: List all subscriptions under path /test1/test2 with at least one message.
trans-unit.target: List all subscriptions under path /test1/test2 with at least one message.

trans-unit.source: List all topics under path /test1/test2 with at least one message.
trans-unit.target: List all topics under path /test1/test2 with at least one message.

trans-unit.source: QueueToQueue Transfer - SendVia
trans-unit.target: QueueToQueue Transfer - SendVia

trans-unit.source: This feature enables you to span transactions across two entities (receive, process, send, and complete in single transaction).
trans-unit.target: This feature enables you to span transactions across two entities (receive, process, send, and complete in single transaction).

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: This feature supports a general stateless workflow processing pattern (receive, process, send, complete in a single transaction).
trans-unit.target: This feature supports a general stateless workflow processing pattern (receive, process, send, complete in a single transaction).

trans-unit.source: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="73a5b714-2563-4e5f-875d-6ebf8d74f9b2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Chaining Service Bus entities with Auto-forwarding</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="73a5b714-2563-4e5f-875d-6ebf8d74f9b2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Chaining Service Bus entities with Auto-forwarding</link>.

trans-unit.source: QueueToQueue Transfer – ForwardTo
trans-unit.target: QueueToQueue Transfer – ForwardTo

trans-unit.source: This feature enables you to create rich messaging topologies by “connecting” entities; for example from a queue/subscription to a queue/topic.
trans-unit.target: This feature enables you to create rich messaging topologies by “connecting” entities; for example from a queue/subscription to a queue/topic.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="73a5b714-2563-4e5f-875d-6ebf8d74f9b2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Chaining Service Bus entities with Auto-forwarding</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="73a5b714-2563-4e5f-875d-6ebf8d74f9b2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Chaining Service Bus entities with Auto-forwarding</link>.

trans-unit.source: Entity Update (disable/enable)
trans-unit.target: Entity Update (disable/enable)

trans-unit.source: The <token>sb2</token> now supports the ability to update existing messaging entities (queue, topic, or subscription) by disabling or re-enabling them.
trans-unit.target: The <token>sb2</token> now supports the ability to update existing messaging entities (queue, topic, or subscription) by disabling or re-enabling them.

trans-unit.source: When you disable an entity, that entity cannot send or receive messages.
trans-unit.target: When you disable an entity, that entity cannot send or receive messages.

trans-unit.source: To use this feature, set the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.EntityStatus</codeEntityReference> enumeration, then call one of the following APIs with the entity description object as a parameter:
trans-unit.target: To use this feature, set the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.EntityStatus</codeEntityReference> enumeration, then call one of the following APIs with the entity description object as a parameter:

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Multi-Property Correlation Filter
trans-unit.target: Multi-Property Correlation Filter

trans-unit.source: Previous versions of the <token>sb2</token> supported two types of filters for subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: Previous versions of the <token>sb2</token> supported two types of filters for subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: The correlation filter scales to large numbers but is limited to a single property/value: the SQL filter is limited to 2000 instances per topic.
trans-unit.target: The correlation filter scales to large numbers but is limited to a single property/value: the SQL filter is limited to 2000 instances per topic.

trans-unit.source: In some scenarios, you may want to add filters for supporting large number of combinations of property name/values.
trans-unit.target: In some scenarios, you may want to add filters for supporting large number of combinations of property name/values.

trans-unit.source: This feature now enables you to set a filter with multiple equality clauses on properties.
trans-unit.target: This feature now enables you to set a filter with multiple equality clauses on properties.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Batched Send and Receive APIs
trans-unit.target: Batched Send and Receive APIs

trans-unit.source: This feature enables you to send, receive, and process messages in batches.
trans-unit.target: This feature enables you to send, receive, and process messages in batches.

trans-unit.source: Do use this feature, use the new API in the following list.
trans-unit.target: Do use this feature, use the new API in the following list.

trans-unit.source: The <token>sb2</token> provides both synchronous and asynchronous versions of the batch send and receive APIs.
trans-unit.target: The <token>sb2</token> provides both synchronous and asynchronous versions of the batch send and receive APIs.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Pre-filtering: Filter Evaluation Prior to Message Publication
trans-unit.target: Pre-filtering: Filter Evaluation Prior to Message Publication

trans-unit.source: In previous versions of the <token>sb2</token>, when a message was published to a topic, the message publication always succeeded (even if the topic message had no subscribers).
trans-unit.target: In previous versions of the <token>sb2</token>, when a message was published to a topic, the message publication always succeeded (even if the topic message had no subscribers).

trans-unit.source: In other words, the filter evaluation was performed asynchronously, after a successful message publication.
trans-unit.target: In other words, the filter evaluation was performed asynchronously, after a successful message publication.

trans-unit.source: If the message did not match any subscribers, the message was dropped (or deadlettered, based on the policy).
trans-unit.target: If the message did not match any subscribers, the message was dropped (or deadlettered, based on the policy).

trans-unit.source: In some scenarios, at the time of message publication the publisher of the message must know whether there are any subscribers.
trans-unit.target: In some scenarios, at the time of message publication the publisher of the message must know whether there are any subscribers.

trans-unit.source: The <token>sb2</token> now enables this scenario, and if there are no subscribers at the time of message publication, the message publication fails.
trans-unit.target: The <token>sb2</token> now enables this scenario, and if there are no subscribers at the time of message publication, the message publication fails.

trans-unit.source: To use this feature, set the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.TopicDescription.EnableFilteringMessagesBeforePublishing</codeEntityReference> property to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: To use this feature, set the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.TopicDescription.EnableFilteringMessagesBeforePublishing</codeEntityReference> property to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Message update on Abandon/Defer/Deadletter
trans-unit.target: Message update on Abandon/Defer/Deadletter

trans-unit.source: This new feature enables you to add or modify message properties when performing <languageKeyword>Abandon</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>Defer</languageKeyword>, or <languageKeyword>DeadLetter</languageKeyword> operations.
trans-unit.target: This new feature enables you to add or modify message properties when performing <languageKeyword>Abandon</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>Defer</languageKeyword>, or <languageKeyword>DeadLetter</languageKeyword> operations.

trans-unit.source: This feature can be useful in scenarios in which there is an application processing error that you want to track if it causes the message to be abandoned.
trans-unit.target: This feature can be useful in scenarios in which there is an application processing error that you want to track if it causes the message to be abandoned.

trans-unit.source: You can do so by adding or modifying the properties of the message, in the <parameterReference>propertiesToModify</parameterReference> parameter of the following APIs:
trans-unit.target: You can do so by adding or modifying the properties of the message, in the <parameterReference>propertiesToModify</parameterReference> parameter of the following APIs:

trans-unit.source: Message Count Details
trans-unit.target: Message Count Details

trans-unit.source: The <token>sb2</token> introduces a new class called <languageKeyword>Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.MessageCountDetails</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: The <token>sb2</token> introduces a new class called <languageKeyword>Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.MessageCountDetails</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: This class contains properties that enable you to retrieve details of messages from sub-queues of primary messaging entities (queues, topics, subscriptions).
trans-unit.target: This class contains properties that enable you to retrieve details of messages from sub-queues of primary messaging entities (queues, topics, subscriptions).

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>MessageCountDetails</languageKeyword> properties are as follows:
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>MessageCountDetails</languageKeyword> properties are as follows:

trans-unit.source: IsBodyConsumed Property
trans-unit.target: IsBodyConsumed Property

trans-unit.source: The <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage</codeEntityReference> class includes a new property, <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.IsBodyConsumed</codeEntityReference>, which enables you to check to see if the message body has been consumed.
trans-unit.target: The <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage</codeEntityReference> class includes a new property, <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.IsBodyConsumed</codeEntityReference>, which enables you to check to see if the message body has been consumed.

trans-unit.source: For example, if a send operation fails, you can check to see if you can try resending the same message.
trans-unit.target: For example, if a send operation fails, you can check to see if you can try resending the same message.

trans-unit.source: Or, if a message is received, you can check to see if its message body has been consumed.
trans-unit.target: Or, if a message is received, you can check to see if its message body has been consumed.

trans-unit.source: If either of the following occurs, <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.IsBodyConsumed</codeEntityReference> is set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>:
trans-unit.target: If either of the following occurs, <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.IsBodyConsumed</codeEntityReference> is set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>:

trans-unit.source: Someone has called <codeEntityReference>M:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.GetBody``1</codeEntityReference> to consume the message body.
trans-unit.target: Someone has called <codeEntityReference>M:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.GetBody``1</codeEntityReference> to consume the message body.

trans-unit.source: A send operation has marked the message as consumed.
trans-unit.target: A send operation has marked the message as consumed.

trans-unit.source: When <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>, then any <languageKeyword>GetBody</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>Send</languageKeyword> operation on that message returns an exception that indicates that the message has been consumed.
trans-unit.target: When <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>, then any <languageKeyword>GetBody</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>Send</languageKeyword> operation on that message returns an exception that indicates that the message has been consumed.

trans-unit.source: You can then reconstruct the message to retry the operation (for example, <codeEntityReference>M:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.Clone</codeEntityReference> the message for a send).
trans-unit.target: You can then reconstruct the message to retry the operation (for example, <codeEntityReference>M:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.Clone</codeEntityReference> the message for a send).

trans-unit.source: BrokeredMessage Clone
trans-unit.target: BrokeredMessage Clone

trans-unit.source: The <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage</codeEntityReference> class includes a new method, <codeEntityReference>M:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.Clone</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: The <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage</codeEntityReference> class includes a new method, <codeEntityReference>M:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.Clone</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: This method enables you to send a clone of a message as a new message.
trans-unit.target: This method enables you to send a clone of a message as a new message.

trans-unit.source: The properties and body of the message are copied to the clone, although system properties are left as-is for new message so that you can selectively copy.
trans-unit.target: The properties and body of the message are copied to the clone, although system properties are left as-is for new message so that you can selectively copy.

trans-unit.source: Note that you can manually set the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.MessageId</codeEntityReference> property after the clone operation.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can manually set the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.MessageId</codeEntityReference> property after the clone operation.

trans-unit.source: Connection String Enhancements
trans-unit.target: Connection String Enhancements

trans-unit.source: Connection strings are useful for scenarios in which you want to deploy your application to one environment (for example, a test environment), then to another environment (such as a production environment).
trans-unit.target: Connection strings are useful for scenarios in which you want to deploy your application to one environment (for example, a test environment), then to another environment (such as a production environment).

trans-unit.source: All you have to do is change the connection string in App.config to point to the new <token>servicensd</token>, and then restart the application.
trans-unit.target: All you have to do is change the connection string in App.config to point to the new <token>servicensd</token>, and then restart the application.

trans-unit.source: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="80ab200e-4fbb-4e12-bcc6-bc2214c494a9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuration Connection Strings</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="80ab200e-4fbb-4e12-bcc6-bc2214c494a9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuration Connection Strings</link>.

trans-unit.source: Support for Content Type JSON in WebHttpRelayBinding
trans-unit.target: Support for Content Type JSON in WebHttpRelayBinding

trans-unit.source: The <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.WebHttpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference> binding now supports JSON as a content format.
trans-unit.target: The <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.WebHttpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference> binding now supports JSON as a content format.

trans-unit.source: To update a relay listener to receive JSON messages, set the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.WebHttpRelayBinding.ContentTypeMapper</codeEntityReference> property of <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.WebHttpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: To update a relay listener to receive JSON messages, set the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.WebHttpRelayBinding.ContentTypeMapper</codeEntityReference> property of <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.WebHttpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: For an example, see the <externalLink><linkText>WebContentTypeMapper sample</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bb943479.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For an example, see the <externalLink><linkText>WebContentTypeMapper sample</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bb943479.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: ConnectionStatusBehavior Changes
trans-unit.target: ConnectionStatusBehavior Changes

trans-unit.source: Previously, the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ConnectionStatusBehavior</codeEntityReference> behavior worked with only one-way bindings.
trans-unit.target: Previously, the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ConnectionStatusBehavior</codeEntityReference> behavior worked with only one-way bindings.

trans-unit.source: You can now use it with all relay listener bindings.
trans-unit.target: You can now use it with all relay listener bindings.

trans-unit.source: WebStreams over HTTPS
trans-unit.target: WebStreams over HTTPS

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> relay bindings use HTTP 1.1 “chunked” transfer encoding.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> relay bindings use HTTP 1.1 “chunked” transfer encoding.

trans-unit.source: Some legacy proxies support only HTTP 1.0, or do not support HTTP 1.1 chunked transfer encoding correctly.
trans-unit.target: Some legacy proxies support only HTTP 1.0, or do not support HTTP 1.1 chunked transfer encoding correctly.

trans-unit.source: This can cause connections from clients behind such legacy proxies to the <token>sb2</token> relay to fail.
trans-unit.target: This can cause connections from clients behind such legacy proxies to the <token>sb2</token> relay to fail.

trans-unit.source: To address this issue, the <token>sb2</token> relay bindings now attempt to connect using HTTPS if previous connection attempts fail.
trans-unit.target: To address this issue, the <token>sb2</token> relay bindings now attempt to connect using HTTPS if previous connection attempts fail.

trans-unit.source: To use this feature, set the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ConnectivitySettings.Mode</codeEntityReference> value in the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ServiceBusEnvironment.SystemConnectivity</codeEntityReference> property to <languageKeyword>AutoDetect</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>Http</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: To use this feature, set the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ConnectivitySettings.Mode</codeEntityReference> value in the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ServiceBusEnvironment.SystemConnectivity</codeEntityReference> property to <languageKeyword>AutoDetect</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>Http</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: <token>crdefault</token> the documentation for the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ConnectivityMode</codeEntityReference> enumeration.
trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> the documentation for the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ConnectivityMode</codeEntityReference> enumeration.

trans-unit.source: Connections cache the protocol used for a successful connection, and subsequent reconnect operations initially attempt to use the cached protocol type.
trans-unit.target: Connections cache the protocol used for a successful connection, and subsequent reconnect operations initially attempt to use the cached protocol type.

trans-unit.source: If hosting behind a firewall, for this feature to work you must allow outbound HTTPS connections to port 443.
trans-unit.target: If hosting behind a firewall, for this feature to work you must allow outbound HTTPS connections to port 443.

trans-unit.source: Proxy Authentication
trans-unit.target: Proxy Authentication

trans-unit.source: Relay connections can fail when the proxy requires authentication.
trans-unit.target: Relay connections can fail when the proxy requires authentication.

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> relay bindings now support connections through proxies configured for <legacyItalic>Integrated Windows Authentication</legacyItalic> or for <legacyItalic>Negotiate</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> relay bindings now support connections through proxies configured for <legacyItalic>Integrated Windows Authentication</legacyItalic> or for <legacyItalic>Negotiate</legacyItalic>.
